oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Superfluid-Mott transitions and vortices in the Jaynes-Cummings-Hubbard lattices with time reversal symmetry breaking
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hayward, Andrew L. C.
Martin, Andrew M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
Condensed Matter - Superconductivity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We investigate the groundstate behaviour of Jaynes-Cummings-Hubbard lattices in the presence of a synthetic magnetic field, via a Gutzwiller ansatz. Specifically, we study the Mott-Superfluid transition, and the formation of vortex lattices in the superfluid regime. We find a suppression of the superfluid fraction due to the frustration induced by the incommensurate magnetic and spacial lattice lengths. We also predict the formation of regime.
